thread.title: Indee-WD, Xavier-Regina highlight Week 8

title: Indee-WD, Xavier-Regina highlight Week 8
text:
Indee-WD, Xavier-Regina highlight Week 8 Indee-WD, Xavier-Regina highlight Week 8 Football: No. 1s remain the same in Gazette/KCRG/KGYM poll Gazette , Iowa Prep Sports , Prep Football , Prep Sports , Preps Etc. By Jeff Linder , Sports , Sports Rotator , Photos Cedar Rapids Xavier’s Sean Murphy (25) breaks free from a tackle by Dubuque Wahlert’s Matthew Bahl (15) during the first quarter of their game Friday. The Saints are ranked No. 3 in Class 3A and play at 1A No. 1 Iowa City Regina on Friday. (Andy Abeyta/The Gazette) Iowa Football Data Center

Sharing community and high school contributed stories Monday October 12, 2015 October 12, 2015 | 5:06 pm 
Pick your showdown of unbeatens. 
There’s the Highway 20 grudge match at Manchester, with the Class 3A District 3 title on the line. 
And there’s the battle for Eastern Iowa Catholic-school supremacy. 
It’s Week 8 of the Iowa high school football season, and Independence-West Delaware and Cedar Rapids Xavier-Iowa City Regina highlight Friday’s action. 
The Gazette/KCRG/KGYM football poll contains no changes at the top. It’s still a tie for the No. 1 position in Class 2A between Albia and Spirit Lake, and the other leaders remain the same. 
West Des Moines Dowling holds the No. 1 spot in Class 4A. It’s Pella in 3A, Regina in 1A, BGM in Class A and Newell-Fonda in 8-Player. 
Pella and Regina are unanimous choices in their respective classes. 
West Delaware and Independence are No. 2 and No. 6 in 3A. The Hawks have the top-scoring team in 3A at 43.9 points per game. Independence won last year’s battle, 10-0. 
The winner of five straight state championships, Regina has won 76 of its last 77 games. One of those victories was last year at Xavier. The Saints are No. 3 in Class 3A. 
Dowling is followed by Bettendorf in 4A, with West Des Moines Valley, Cedar Rapids Kennedy and Cedar Rapids Washington rounding out the top five. 
Albia and Spirit Lake both received 73 points in the 2A balloting, with Albia receiving four first-place votes and Spirit Lake three. South Tama is third, Anamosa fourth. 
Regina’s closest challengers in 1A are Dike-New Hartford, West Branch and Underwood. 
BGM garnered seven first-place votes in Class A. Algona Garrigan is second, followed by Denver. 
Don Bosco is second to defending-champion Newell-Fonda in 8-Player. Marcus MMC is third.
